result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra M. Wildman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete probation in 14CF102 and comply with deferred entry of judgment

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 16 days if revoked.
Consecutive to: to 14-CF-102

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Mental Health assessment if not already completed and follow through.
Anger Management counseling unless probation agent deem not necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra M. Wildman

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC with response by Judge Rhode
Victim Notice of Rights & Victim Notification Card - Returned

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF192, 15CF156 and 18CF34 @ 2:50 p.m. Agreement stated - 18CF34 Def will plead to charge, 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 24 mo es, concurrent to any other serving. 15CF156 ct 1 - 48 mo prison, 24 mo ic, 24 mo es, concurrent to any, 304 cays credit. 14CF192 ct 1 - 48 mo prison, 24 mo ic, 24 mo es, concurrent to any other currently serving. 304 days credit. Def eligible for SAP and CIP. Costs on 18CF34. Atty Laufenberg agrees. 18CF34 information being filed, mirrors complaint. Off the record briefly. Def understands agreement and agrees with terms. Court reviews prelim rights w/Def. Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over in 18CF34. Copy of information received, reading waived, reserve objections. Parties have received revocation summary. No additions or corrections. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to 18CF34 ct 1 - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely and voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds Def guilty of 18CF34 ct 1. Sentencing remarks by State. Sentencing remarks by Atty Laufenberg. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Orders on 18CF34 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 months ic, 24 months es, costs, DNA surcharge. 15CF156 ct 1, 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 304 days served. Outstanding costs to be paid through es on both cases. 14CF192 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 304 days served. Def is eligible for SAP and CIP. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights. 18CF34 - DNA sample if not already on file.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 2, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF156, 14CF192 & 15CF237  @ 10:17 am.  State gives plea agreement, 14CF192 Motion to revoke defer agreement, ct 1 15CF156 plea, ct's 1 & 5 Dismissed, 15CF237 Dismissed, & a referral from Langlade County Sheriff for Disorderly Conduct not charged, withheld sentence 3 years probation, consecutive to 14CF102, costs, Restitution, DNA Sample, DNA Surcharge in 15CF156, AODA and follow through & Mental Health assessment and follow through, and Anger Management, Restitution of  85.36 in 15CF156. Atty Morgan and def. agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  15CF156 Ct 1 Forgery, repeater, no contest plea.  State has not filed and information. Information filed, Atty Morgan has copy of information, waives reading.  15CF156 Ct's DRI 2-5, 15CF237 Dismissed ct's 1 & 2, Court will note on 4-13-16 of D.C. not charged. Victim rights have been complied with.  Victim on 15CF156 in courtroom.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Morgan is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given. Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accept plea, and finds def. Guilty to Forgery, repeater, in Ct. 1. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Morgan gives sentencing recommendation. Def. has nothing to say. Def. now makes statement. Court approves agreement and orders on 
14CF192 Court revokes defer agreement and orders on ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, consecutive to 14CF102, court costs,  Mental Health assessment if already not completed and follow through and Anger Management counseling unless probation agent deem not necessary, 16 days credit if revoked on ct 1. 
15CF156 Ct 1 - withheld sentence 3 years probation, concurrent with 14CF192 & consecutive to 14CF102, court costs, Restitution 85.36, DNA Sample & $250 DNA Surcharge, same conditions as on 14CF192, no credit. 15CF237 Poster would like bond returned.  Bond to be returned to poster. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights. Atty Morgan heard on 90 days jail.  State heard on offer.  Def. was confused.  No jail was ordered on new cases.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel has filed a written waiver of preliminary.  Court reviews this form with def.  Def has signed document.  Right to preliminary explained to def.  Def waives preliminary.  Court will accept waiver.  Probable cause found, bound over.  Information filed.  Information received, waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will receive not guilty pleas.  14CF192 & 15CF156 will be set for status conf on same date.  14CF192 motion to revoke DP will be addressed by court at later date.  15CF237 request to return bond, court will not change bond.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF102 and 14CF192 @ 11:18 a.m. 14CF102 - Def will plead to charge, joint recommendation, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as deemed appropriate, 31 days jail, credit for 14 days if revoked, court costs. Def will report today. 14CF192 - Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, ct 1 - defer judgment 2 yrs, if successfully completes probation in 14CF102, no crimes to probable cause, pays all court obligations in 14CF102, will dismiss. Review  2/6/17 @ 1:00 p.m. Victim notification rights complied with. State will not ask for bond forf in 14CF102 and bond returned to poster. Court will grant. 14CF192, State asks bond be converted to signature, no possess prescription drugs w/o valid prescription, cash be returned to poster. Court grants.  14CF102 - No contest plea. Stipulate to factual basis. Atty Morgan has reveiwed charges and possible penalties. Court reviews plea quest. and constitutional rights. Atty Morgan satisfied. Court finds plea knowingly made and finds guilty of ct 1.  Nothing by Defendant. Court adopts agreement. Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow up and counseling deemed appropriate, 31 days jail, credit for 14 days if revoked, court costs including DNA surcharge. Def must report by 6 p.m on 2/6/15. Postconviction rights. 14CF192 - plea to ct 1 - no contest. Agree that all questions asked in previous case follow for this case. Stipulate factual basis. Ct 2 dismissed read in. Court approves deferred judgment agreement. Bond modified to $500 signature, cash bond return to poster. Condition as stated earlier.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF102 & 14CF192 @ 1:35 pm. State is ready to proceed on both cases with preliminary hearing. 14CF102 State call Deputy Daniel Bauknecht, Deputy Sheriff Inv for Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State rest.  Court finds probable cause & bind over.  Information Filed.  Atty Morgan has copy of information, waives reading, & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty plea. State is ready to proceed with bail bond forfeiture. Court will adjourn bail bond forfeiture. 14CF192 State is ready to proceed.  Court to take Judicial notice of bail bond in 14CF102, Court takes judicial notice.  Daniel J. Duley, Det. for City of Antigo Police Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State rest.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Morgan has copy of information, waives reading, & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty plea on all ct's. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF102 & 14CF192.  Def no longer wants Atty Schuster.  Motion and Order to withdraw.  Court grants.  14CF192 has status conf.  State request both matters be adjourned until then.  Def has contacted public defender for new atty.  Court will adjourn both cases for new counsel.  Letter from poster of bond.  Court reviews letter.  Poster requesting bond be returned.  State give arguments.  Court will return the bond of $500.00 to poster.  Cash bond will remain.  Bond forfeiture will be adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 1:52 pm.  State moves to lift no contact provision.  Court will remove no contact provision on bond, no need for new bond, copy of minutes to Sheriff's Dept.
No possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.   No contact with Wayne Wildman

Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in court via video with attorney Jessica L. Schuster.  Defendant Cassandra M. Wildman in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Reviewed.  Review of bond, arguments by Atty Schuster.  Response by DA for bond to continue.  Court will reduce bond.   Time limits for preliminary waived.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
